description: After the newest update, the only right rating is full stars.
looks good on Kubuntu 23.10 so far!
Installing worked, then ran. But after closing the app, it never worked again.
Really nice simple app. Does what it needs to without distracting or getting in your way.
Once signed in the app appears unresponsive and goes black each time I try to interact with it. (PostmarketOS, Pinephone)
Worked seamlessly for me. I only wish I could change the font size in the app itself.
goodbye (sorry)
Doesn't have a lot of features yet but still gives enough to be able to browse your feed
Good app, but crashes sometimes, and scrolling is unnatural.
summary: Good app but has some problems

description:
Needs a tap and hold for copying / selecting text. But regular touches should scroll. Makes it hard to use. Great start though!

Theme needs work, doesnt adapt properly to darkmode, cant read login screen things.

Bugs:
1. The Home Tab takes a lot of time to load.
2. Settings option in the bottom left breaks when you reside the window on wayland.

Features:
1. There no cards displaying embedded links like other toots and videos. So I can't see whats on the other end without clicking.
2. When you click on an embedded toot link, I opens mastodon in the browser. I should be redirected to the linked toot and go back to previous page using a back button.
Starts. Then stops immediately. Hopeless.

I don't know if there's a theming issue or what, but the textboxes appear almost black and any text in them is illegible without highlighting it. I almost gave up assuming it wasn't taking my text inputs until I accidentally highlighted them. If that were fixed it'd be competent, though quite barebones, but if that's your thing then go for it.
Not bad for a native Mastodon client, good so far. Although there is still some work and improvements needed to be done, it's overall a seamless experience for me at the moment
summary: Good Mastodon client for KDE Plasma

description: Not easy to use, dosn't work well with a Gnome desktop. Maybe there's a back button or other buttons that only work in KDE plasma? I'm not sure. But the app isn't very easy to use, not easy to follow threads, not easy to go back to something you were previously viewing.
summary: Doesn't Integrate Well With Gnome, Not Intuitive

description:
Works well in Manjaro Plasma Mobile on the PinePhone. 
A few minor features do not work. (I can't change profile picture.)
Some features seem missing.

So yeah, on the Steam Deck this app works so and so.

But seriously, how do you see your own toots/posts on #Tokodon? Mine just disappear after I post them. Nothing can be found inside my "#Home". Sometimes they do appear but under extremely buggy circumstances.
This app is buggy in more ways than one. Practically #Home is empty, its like this app was shipped before it was finished.

Right now I can see this on the website but not on Tokodon!

What am I doing wrong? I just wanna go to my profile and see my posts.
summary: Why is #Home empty like all the time?

description: Works fantastic on the Steam Deck!
Tokodon integriert sich super in das Plasma-Ökosystem. Einfach, schlicht und schnell.
I experienced it as responsive and clear in usability and features, but it crashes very often. So I cannot recommend it for daily usage.
Pas réussi une seule fois à le faire fonctionner : plante à chaque fois au démarrage
